channel.title: where are the network tools? on MyThinkPond
channel.description: Recent content in where are the network tools? on MyThinkPond

item.title: CentOS7 missing Net-Tools Package and why you should not install it moving forward
item.description: In CentOS 7, a lot of the command-line utilities for configuring and troubleshooting network properties like arp, ifconfig, iptunnel, iwconfig, nameif, netstat, route - are no longer there in the new CentOS 7 version. While still included in many Linux Distributions, (and you may be tempted to run - ‘yum install net-tools’ - to get them back into your Linux footprint). But they are considered deprecated and therefore should be phased out in favor of more modern replacements.
